place_info.title: Tevar - The Progressive Indian Kitchen & Bar
place_info.address: Block, Gate no. 11, SALARPURIA SATTVA ARGUS, SALARPURIA SATTVA KNOWLEDGE CITY, Shop 3, Unit 2, Hyderabad, Telangana 500081, India

reviews.snippet: Ambience is amazing.  Food is yummy and the presentation is impressive. However it's premium so expect a hit on your wallet. Desserts are so dammnnn good. Must try.

extracted_snippet.original: Ambience is amazing.  Food is yummy and the presentation is impressive. However it's premium so expect a hit on your wallet. Desserts are so dammnnn good. Must try.

reviews.snippet: Tevar serves some really great food with plenty of options to choose from. We went there for dinner and loved the overall ambience—calm and nicely done. It’s a good spot to visit for a relaxed meal, though it’s slightly on the expensive side. I’d recommend making a reservation in advance as it can get quite busy during peak hours.

extracted_snippet.original: Tevar serves some really great food with plenty of options to choose from. We went there for dinner and loved the overall ambience—calm and nicely done. It’s a good spot to visit for a relaxed meal, though it’s slightly on the expensive side. I’d recommend making a reservation in advance as it can get quite busy during peak hours.

details.recommended_dishes: Dal Makhani, Rasmalai Cake, Railway Mutton Curry

reviews.snippet:
All the other reviews are fake or they force their customer to give a good reviews.
But this place is absolute worthless.
They claim to be fine dine but don’t provide any appetisers or ambush food. They are expensive to height yet they force you to pay service charges. Plus our waiter without even asking served us water which cost ₹255/-
Food taste was basic which you can get at any average restaurant. Don’t go here just to pay hefty price for presentation and ambience.

reviews.snippet:
Don't go by the reviews. It's a instagrammable place where food is pathetic in taste and hospitality is even worse. They serve stale cold food and when given feedback, refuse to accept it.  We tried all recommended dishes and ended up being extremely disappointed. Very bad experience.
Not recommended to anyone.

reviews.snippet:
Very good experience for sure.
I liked all dishes but  chaat is my all time favourite 😍. All dishes are with twist of unique taste.
Place looks good too. It was not noisy. They do serve liquor. Mocktails are very good.

details.group_size: 5-8 people, Suitable for all group sizes
details.seating_type: Indoor dining area, Bar area, Counter seating

reviews.snippet:
On a weekend evening went to check Tevar and have dinner with friends.

The place is modern indian focused both on food and ambiance. On the side with dining tables and bar it looks nice  but on the side with high tables towards the screen it looks very unimpressive and random. Definitely not like a supposedly high end luxury dining.

Service was very good, attentive and quick.

For food and drinks we tried different items, all of which tasted good, probably the highlight was the blue cheese chicken tikka.

Price is definitely on the higher end, definitely not budget friendly.

Overall we had a satisfactory experience.

extracted_snippet.original:

Overall we had a satisfactory experience.

reviews.snippet:
Tevar used to be the most happening place when they opened. Visited them today for lunch, surprised that it’s half empty even on a Valentine’s Day lunch. The staff were courteous, food was good, portion size was decent. Then I guess it’s the cuisine that makes it difficult to justify premium pricing.

Order Aloo Tuk Tuk only if there are three or more to share, two of us couldn’t have that much Aloo. Darjeeling Jhol Momos were great.

Baingan Bhartha Duo is a nice concept. The Rotis we ordered were good. Paneer is good too. At a 25% lesser price, they will get more people.

reviews.snippet: We had an amazing experience. The mocktails and food was great, especially the non veg dishes like lamb seekh kabab, thecha chicken tikka and coconut prawn. The Pista Gulab jamu rabdi was too good.

extracted_snippet.original: We had an amazing experience. The mocktails and food was great, especially the non veg dishes like lamb seekh kabab, thecha chicken tikka and coconut prawn. The Pista Gulab jamu rabdi was too good.

details.recommended_dishes: Coconut Prawns, Achari Paneer Tikka, Rasmalai Cake, Mojito, Live Chaat, Thecha Chicken Tikka

reviews.snippet:
A Must-Try Culinary Experience in Hyderabad!

From start to finish, our dining experience was nothing short of amazing! The food was exceptional, and the service by Badal Singh made it even more special—he served each dish with care and patience, adding a personal touch to our meal.

If you’re in Hyderabad, this restaurant is a must-visit! Be sure to try these incredible dishes: Deconstructed samosa, dhokla, achari paneer tikka, chilli garlic shrimps, onion chilli roti, baingan bharta, and mili juli jalfrezi. Each bite was packed with flavor and beautifully presented.

Highly recommended for an unforgettable food experience!

extracted_snippet.original:

If you’re in Hyderabad, this restaurant is a must-visit! Be sure to try these incredible dishes: Deconstructed samosa, dhokla, achari paneer tikka, chilli garlic shrimps, onion chilli roti, baingan bharta, and mili juli jalfrezi. Each bite was packed with flavor and beautifully presented.

Highly recommended for an unforgettable food experience!

reviews.snippet:
Tevar is an exceptional spot for a business dinner or a relaxed evening out. The food is consistently top-notch—flavorful, well-presented, and clearly made with quality ingredients. The service is equally impressive: attentive without being intrusive, and always professional.

What really sets Tevar apart is its atmosphere. The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between upscale and inviting, making it ideal for both casual and formal dining. Their selection of liquor is also worth noting, with a well-curated list that pairs nicely with the menu.

Overall, Tevar delivers on all fronts—great food, excellent service, and a memorable dining experience. Highly recommended.

What really sets Tevar apart is its atmosphere. The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between upscale and inviting, making it ideal for both casual and formal dining. Their selection of liquor is also worth noting, with a well-curated list that pairs nicely with the menu.

Overall, Tevar delivers on all fronts—great food, excellent service, and a memorable dining experience. Highly recommended.

reviews.snippet: Food preparation and menu in terms of innovation is really good, one should definitely visit for the items. But service is really lacking. They market themselves as a fine dining place, yet don't fill glasses, don't time the courses correctly, etc.

extracted_snippet.original: Food preparation and menu in terms of innovation is really good, one should definitely visit for the items. But service is really lacking. They market themselves as a fine dining place, yet don't fill glasses, don't time the courses correctly, etc.

details.recommended_dishes: Paneer Mille Feuille, Avocado Kulfi, Magic Mushroom 65, Arbi Ki Gilavat, Nadru Ki Kakori
details.vegetarian_options: Good innovation in veg section. Loved the appetizers
details.dietary_restrictions: They do have some jain/vegan options

reviews.snippet: We went for lunch here. All the food items ordered are tasty. They presented the food sp well. The dessert don't break my heart is so yummy. I would love to go as many times as possible. But the prices are a little high.

extracted_snippet.original: We went for lunch here. All the food items ordered are tasty. They presented the food sp well. The dessert don't break my heart is so yummy. I would love to go as many times as possible. But the prices are a little high.

reviews.snippet:
The taste seemed to have gone down when compared to my previous visits.

Coconut Prawns was over fried and very hard. Marina Beach fish fry was good.

The Mango preparation in Aamras poori was very good. However the poor were very small.

Cheese chicken rolls were okay. Butter chicken, mutton curry and Naans were good.

My experience went from super in the previous visits to good.

reviews.snippet:
Great food. Pineapple mint Raita was awesome. Aloo tuk tuk could have been better. Nepali jhol momo was very good.
Another highlight was the Baingan Bharta Duo - loved it
Vikas Naik was a great host

reviews.snippet:
Tevar – The Progressive Indian Kitchen & Bar, located in Hyderabad’s Sattva Knowledge City, offers a modern twist on traditional Indian cuisine. The restaurant’s chic ambiance features maroon and gold hues, intricate jharokha-style designs, and antique golden lamps, creating a sophisticated dining environment.  ￼

The menu showcases innovative takes on Indian classics, such as the Dhokla Blast topped with tangy fermented yogurt, and the Nadru Bhel, a crispy creation of fried lotus stem slices mixed with spices and chutneys. The live Pani Puri counter adds an interactive element, with chefs preparing the dish tableside.  ￼

While the culinary creativity is commendable, some patrons have noted that the prices are on the higher side, with an average cost of around ₹1,500 per person. Additionally, there have been mixed reviews regarding service efficiency and food quality.  ￼

In summary, Tevar provides a luxurious dining experience that blends contemporary and classic Indian flavors. However, potential diners should be prepared for premium pricing and may want to manage their expectations regarding service and food consistency.

reviews.snippet:
Rex Thapa’s  service was super.

“We had an amazing experience thanks to Rex Thapa! They were attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu, offering excellent recommendations that enhanced our meal. The service was prompt, and they ensured we had everything we needed throughout our visit. Their professionalism and warm demeanor made our dining experience truly memorable. Highly recommend this place, and we’ll definitely be back!”

reviews.snippet:
We had gone to this place for a celebration for dinner and we really liked the food and service. Ambience was also pretty nice.

We ordered few veg dishes and they were really tasty. Overall good experience. Only con was that we informed of the celebration during reservation itself, but they didn’t arrange for a cake.

reviews.snippet: Food and ambience were great! Gagan was our server and he took great care of us! The qawali night was a great night to be here. Definitely coming back 😊

reviews.snippet:
Modern settings with good food (mostly Indian with a twist). Although on the costlier side.
Ambience is nice with acceptable background music on all days except Sunday, Wednesday and Fridays (live music on these days).

reviews.snippet:
We have ordered.

1. Chilli garlic shrimps
2. Nimbu Mirchi Fish
3. Jama - Masjid chicken tikka
4. Kacche Ghost Ki Biriyani
5. Nalli Roganjosh
6. Shirfal Julep
7. Virgin Mojito

This place has won my heart, a huge shoutout to Prana who has assisted us with the menu and has explained about each dish that was served to us.. The food was simply delicious, all that we have ordered was recommended by the staff and it tasted amazing. The ambience is welcoming and has a very pleasant atmosphere.
The aroma of the Biriyani was amazing, Would have been much better/ tastier if the Biriyani had  more masala in it since I felt it was dry.

Must visit place with family and friends.

reviews.snippet: Really loved the restaurant. Modern settings, excellent service. We adore the drinks and the food was delicious (mostly modern Indian with a twist). Special shoutout to the truffle broccoli and live station pav bhaji. Service was attentive and the music was 🔥. We will definitely be back!

reviews.snippet: Good ambience and nice food. Service was little OK as one server was trying to look after multiple tables.

reviews.snippet:
They have their own vibe going. Went on a Friday night .. amazing. Totally enjoyed the Qawaali and service is amazing.

In food I found options to be limited but whatever they have is good. Liked their drinks too.
Do go with the server’s recommendation.

reviews.snippet:
One of the best culinary experiences in a very long time. The food is outstanding in taste and presentation. ( better than some of the Michelin star restaurants I have been to) We went there for family lunch. The service was delightful. The ambience is classy.

Our family favourite - Blush drink, Chicken Tikka Thecha. Kale Patta Chaat and black carrot halwa have surreal taste and presentation.

details.recommended_dishes: Kale Chaat, Thecha Chicken Tikka, Makkhan Malai Kofta

reviews.snippet:
It was an incredible experience from start to finish. The food was just wow! Each dish was bursting with flavor and beautifully presented like a work of art.
Hats off to chef!
Special shout out to Tisso. He managed servicing well.

extracted_snippet.original:
It was an incredible experience from start to finish. The food was just wow! Each dish was bursting with flavor and beautifully presented like a work of art.

reviews.snippet:
The welcome drink was very impressive, cinnamon tea served in a tiny cup. Good ambiance. Ordered coconut prawns as starter, it was served within few minutes (not as hot as out of the frying pan). Taste wise I would rate one ⭐️. Slightly over priced, may be due to location and ambience. It was a week day, still they have very less available tables for the walk in customers. We went there for dinner, but had to leave for other place due to taste and sitting options offered to us. To visit with prior booking is recommended.

Not at all a good experience. May not visit again.

reviews.snippet: From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with genuine warmth and professionalism. Rex went above and beyond to make our dining experience unforgettable — attentive without being intrusive, knowledgeable about the menu, and full of thoughtful recommendations that truly enhanced our meal. Every course was beautifully presented and packed with flavor, showcasing the kitchen's skill and creativity. The timing of service was flawless, and we never felt rushed. It's rare to find a place where both the food and service are this outstanding. Highly recommend — we’ll definitely be back!
